original_title: A Movement Against the Transparency of the Stars of the Seas
overview: A contemplation on the meanings of movement in the migration experience: the grace and skill of a Filipina domestic worker are juxtaposed with devotional dances to the Santo Ni√±o statue that Magellan brought to the islands in 1521. The ensuing galleon trade of silk and porcelain for New World silver initiated the global economy, and the cycle where female care labor is now the commodity in demand.
title: A Movement Against the Transparency of the Stars of the Seas
